name: Whack-A-Phobe!
description:
The Trijam challenge :

A game made in 3 hours (per team member) 

The theme:

Leave me alone! The game: When you're queer, a significant part of your social life is spent fielding "well-meaning" but nonetheless invasive and judgmental comments on stuff that's really not people's business! In this game, you'll get a choice to smash the queerphobia out of your nosy relatives, gossipy coworkers, and rude acquaintances. Literally. Welcome to Whack-A-Phobe! Warning: Contains ordinary queerphobia, and swearing (which can be avoided with the "No swearing" mode). 

The team:
  • LaChapeliere (she/her): Writing (itch.io)
  • BattleDumpling (she/they): Programming (itch.io, twitter)
  • Verdax (he/him): Programming (itch.io)
  • Leah Bouhuys (she/her): 3D Assets/Animation (itch.io, twitter, personal website)
  • Ams (they/them): 3D Assets/Animation (itch.io, twitter, artstation)
  • Ryan Whyman (he/him): Music and SFX (itch.io)
How to play: 

Click on the ugly queerphobic mole to whack it. The more moles you whack, the higher your score, and the more optimistic your story conclusion. Each level is 30 sec long, and the game contains 3 levels.
